question: Which of the following factors affect the electronic conductance of a metal?
option1: the nature and structure of the metal
option2: the number of valence electrons per atom
explanation: Electrical conductance through metals is called metallic or electronic conductance and is due to the movement of electrons. The electronic conductance depends on (i) the nature and structure of the metal (ii) the number of valence electrons per atom (iii) temperature (it decreases with increase of temperature).
